Clipboard.summary:
The Clipboard interface of the Clipboard API provides read and write access to the contents of the system clipboard.
This allows a web application to implement cut, copy, and paste features.

remarks.para: The system clipboard is exposed through the global property.

All of the Clipboard API methods operate asynchronously; they return a which is resolved once the clipboard access has been completed.
The promise is rejected if clipboard access is denied.

All the methods require a secure context.
Additional requirements for using the API are discussed in the Security consideration section of the API overview topic.

ClipboardClipboardchange.summary: NOTE Experimental The clipboardchange event of the interface is fired when the system clipboard contents are changed in any way, for example via a system copy command, or via an API method such as .

ClipboardRead.summary: The read() method of the interface requests a copy of the clipboard's contents, fulfilling the returned {{jsxref("Promise")}} with the data.

remarks.para:
The method can in theory return arbitrary data (unlike , which can only return text).
Browsers commonly support reading text, HTML, and PNG image data.

-Clipboard API
-Unblocking clipboard access on web.dev
-Unsanitized HTML in the Async Clipboard API on developer.chrome.com
-
-
-

ClipboardRead.returns: A {{jsxref("Promise")}} that resolves with an array of objects containing the clipboard's contents.

ClipboardReadText.summary: The readText() method of the interface returns a {{jsxref("Promise")}} which fulfills with a copy of the textual contents of the system clipboard.

blockquote.para:
To read non-text contents from the clipboard, use the method instead.
You can write text to the clipboard using .

remarks.para:
-Clipboard API
-Image support for Async Clipboard article
-
-
-

ClipboardReadText.returns: A that resolves with a string containing the textual contents of the clipboard.Returns an empty string if the clipboard is empty, does not contain text, or does not include a textual representation among the objects representing the clipboard's contents.

ClipboardWrite.summary:
The write() method of the interface writes arbitrary data such as images and text to the clipboard, fulfilling the returned {{jsxref("Promise")}} on completion.
This can be used to implement cut and copy functionality.

remarks.para:
The method can in theory write arbitrary data (unlike , which can only write text).
Browsers commonly support writing text, HTML, and PNG image data.

-Clipboard API
-Image support for Async Clipboard article
-
-
-

ClipboardWrite.returns:
A which is resolved when the data has been written to the clipboard.
Note that if the underlying OS does not support multiple native clipboard items on the system clipboard, then only the first in the array is written.The promise is rejected if the clipboard is unable to write to the clipboard.

ClipboardWriteText.summary: The writeText() method of the interface writes the specified text to the system clipboard, returning a {{jsxref("Promise")}} that is resolved once the system clipboard has been updated.

remarks.para:
-Clipboard API
-Image support for Async Clipboard article
-
-
-

ClipboardWriteText.returns: A that is resolved once the clipboard's contents have been updated.
